intro: Seseli sibiricum, commonly known as Siberian seseli, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branched stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small white or pale yellow flowers appear in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Seseli sibiricum is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates.
